title: Re: Two-button firing or Space?
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]How hard would it be to add an option for 2 button firing like in keen4 etc?[hr][/quote]
Easy. Since Keeners will be using a batch file to start the game anyway, you could just let them choose then. Have two patches; one for two button and one for space.

Something like this would do the trick. It would be nice to use only one options file, but environment variables are broken in DOSbox, necessitating a workaround.
[pre] @ECHO OFFIF "%1"=="/c" GOTO :MAKEOPTSIF "%1"=="/C" GOTO :MAKEOPTSIF EXIST SPACEFIR.DAT GOTO STARTSPCIF EXIST CTALTFIR.DAT GOTO STARTTWO:MAKEOPTSECHO Preparing to start YOUR-MOD....ECHO Would you like to fire with (C)ontrol and Alt or (S)pace?CHOICE /C:CS /N ("CKSELECT /C" to choose again)IF ERRORLEVEL == 2 GOTO STARTSPCIF ERRORLEVEL == 1 GOTO STARTTWO:STARTSPCECHO Starting MOD-NAME using space to fire....ECHO TRUE > SPACEFIR.DATIF EXIST CTALTFIR.DAT DEL CTALTFIR.DATCK1PATCH MODSPACE.PATGOTO END:STARTTWOECHO Starting MOD-NAME with two-button firing....ECHO TRUE > CTALTFIR.DATIF EXIST SPACEFIR.DAT DEL SPACEFIR.DATCK1PATCH MODCTALT.PATGOTO END:END[/pre]________________

title: Re: Two-button firing or Space?
content:
I use Space because with 2-button firing I end wasting my ammo when I try to use the pogo. I also use reversed jump buttons (ALT for jump and CTRL for pogo) because it's easier to do the pogo trick with the keys in that order with CK4-6. I don't have any problems with two-button firing and the default keys in CK1-3, though.[hr]
